TopicTitle: Orbital drift, weird issues with rootparts

Articles.Content:
Hello,

since a few days I have a problem with unstable orbits (orbital drifts). After starting a sat and release it from my rocket the Ap und Pe are very unstable, growing and shrink every few seconds. I did a reinstall of KSP (1.8.1), start a new Game. That dind`t change anything. Also sometimes after releasing the sat, the rockt is in a stable orbit and the sat has a negative Pe so it deorbit.
The orbital drift compensation is on (default) in the settings.

Here is my log:
https://www.file-upload.net/download-14230930/KSP.log.html

And here is a new one:

https://www.file-upload.net/download-14249954/KSP.log.html

Edited September 3, 2020 by Cheesecake
Is this while timewarping?  If so, it's been around for ages and it doesn't seem likely that it will get fixed.

No, not in Timewarp. In Timewarp the orbit is stable.
There is no engine or RCS onboard.

Edited August 13, 2020 by Cheesecake

A new issue has appeared.
I launched a sat with my rocket. After reaching an orbit and releasing the sat from the upper stage, the upper stage was in orbit furthermore. But the sat had a negative Pe so it deorbited.
Here is a new log:

https://www.file-upload.net/download-14249954/KSP.log.htm

And again a new issue:

If the rootpart isn`t inside the fairing, the acceleration during launch goes up the first meters after start, then goes nearly to 0 at a height of ca. 2000 Meters. After that, the speed increases slowly again.


- rootpart is outside of the fairing: acceleration is very bad. At MECO (main engine cut off) I reach a Ap of only 56 km by a speed of mach 2.5.
- rootpart is inside the fairing: acceleration is OK. At MECO i reach a Ap of 220 km by a speed of mach 6.7.
Test with stock-fairngs and SAF.

Since you’ve posted in the modded installs section, I’m going to guess that you’re using mods- if so:

What mods? What versions? What version of KSP and which, if any, DLCs? Try to find Player.log/Player.txt instead of the KSP.txt log as the former has much more detail in it, and/or add screenshots/a video as it sounds like this would be easier to understand by seeing it.
